results.question: Show government revenue (percent of GDP) for Australia from 2010 to 2020
results.ground_truth_sql:
SELECT g.year, g.value AS revenue_pct_gdp
FROM gfs_observations g
JOIN countries c ON g.country_id = c.country_id
JOIN sectors s ON g.sector_id = s.sector_id
JOIN indicators i ON g.indicator_id = i.indicator_id
WHERE c.country_name = 'Australia'
AND s.sector_name = 'General government'
AND i.indicator_name = 'Revenue, Transactions (cash basis of recording), Cash basis'
AND g.transformation = 'Percent of GDP'
AND g.year BETWEEN 2010 AND 2020
ORDER BY g.year
results.predicted_sql: SELECT gem_observations.year, gem_observations.value AS revenue_percent_gdp FROM gem_observations g JOIN countries ON 1=1 c ON gem_observations.country_id = gem_observations.country_id WHERE countries.country_name = 'Australia' AND gem_observations.indicator_id = 1 AND gem_observations.seasonal_adjustment = 1 AND gem_observations.year BETWEEN 2010 AND 2020 ORDER BY gem_observations.year

results.question: Show the stock market index for the United Kingdom from 2015 to 2023
results.ground_truth_sql:
SELECT g.year, g.value AS stock_market
FROM gem_observations g
JOIN countries c ON g.country_id = c.country_id
JOIN indicators i ON g.indicator_id = i.indicator_id
WHERE c.country_name = 'United Kingdom'
AND i.indicator_name = 'Stock Markets'
AND g.year BETWEEN 2015 AND 2023
ORDER BY g.year
results.predicted_sql: SELECT gfs_observations.year, gfs_observations.value AS stock_market_index FROM gfs_observations g JOIN countries ON 1=1 c ON gfs_observations.country_id = gfs_observations.country_id WHERE countries.country_name = 'United Kingdom' AND gfs_observations.indicator_id = 1 AND gfs_observations.sector_id = 2 AND gfs_observations.year BETWEEN 2015 AND 2023 ORDER BY gfs_observations.year

results.question: Show GDP at market prices for the United States for all available years
results.ground_truth_sql:
SELECT g.year, g.value AS gdp_millions
FROM gem_observations g
JOIN countries c ON g.country_id = c.country_id
JOIN indicators i ON g.indicator_id = i.indicator_id
WHERE c.country_name = 'United States'
AND i.indicator_name = 'GDP at market prices'
AND i.unit = 'constant 2010 US$, millions'
ORDER BY g.year
results.predicted_sql: SELECT gfs_observations.year, gfs_observations.value AS gdp_millions FROM gfs_observations g JOIN countries ON 1=1 c ON gfs_observations.country_id = gfs_observations.country_id WHERE countries.country_name = 'United States' AND gfs_observations.indicator_id = 1 AND gfs_observations.frequency = 'Annual' ORDER BY gfs_observations.year

results.question: Show terms of trade for Australia from 2010 to 2023
results.ground_truth_sql:
SELECT g.year, g.value AS terms_of_trade
FROM gem_observations g
JOIN countries c ON g.country_id = c.country_id
JOIN indicators i ON g.indicator_id = i.indicator_id
WHERE c.country_name = 'Australia'
AND i.indicator_name = 'Terms of Trade'
AND g.year BETWEEN 2010 AND 2023
ORDER BY g.year

results.question: Find country-years with high unemployment rate (>10%) from GEM data between 2010 and 2020
results.ground_truth_sql:
SELECT
    c.country_name,
    g.year,
    g.value AS unemployment_rate
FROM gem_observations g
JOIN countries c ON g.country_id = c.country_id
JOIN indicators i ON g.indicator_id = i.indicator_id
WHERE i.indicator_name = 'Unemployment Rate'
    AND g.year BETWEEN 2010 AND 2020
    AND g.value > 10
ORDER BY g.value DESC
results.predicted_sql: SELECT countries.country_name, time_periods.year FROM gem_observations g JOIN countries ON 1=1 c ON gem_observations.country_id = gem_observations.country_id JOIN time_periods ON 1=1 t ON time_periods.year = time_periods.year WHERE gem_observations.value > 10 AND time_periods.year BETWEEN 2010 AND 2020 ORDER BY gem_observations.value DESC LIMIT 10

results.question: List the top 5 countries by number of GEM observations
results.ground_truth_sql:
SELECT c.country_name, COUNT(*) AS obs_count
FROM gem_observations g
JOIN countries c ON g.country_id = c.country_id
GROUP BY c.country_name
ORDER BY obs_count DESC
LIMIT 5
results.predicted_sql: SELECT countries.country_name, COUNT(gem_observations.observation_id) AS num_observations FROM gem_observations go JOIN countries ON 1=1 c ON gem_observations.country_id = gem_observations.country_id GROUP BY countries.country_name ORDER BY num_observations DESC LIMIT 5

results.question: Show government social benefits (percent of GDP) for Germany from 2000 to 2020
results.ground_truth_sql:
SELECT g.year, g.value AS social_benefits_pct_gdp
FROM gfs_observations g
JOIN countries c ON g.country_id = c.country_id
JOIN sectors s ON g.sector_id = s.sector_id
JOIN indicators i ON g.indicator_id = i.indicator_id
WHERE c.country_name = 'Germany'
AND s.sector_name = 'General government'
AND i.indicator_name = 'Social benefits, Transactions (cash basis of recording), Cash basis'
AND g.transformation = 'Percent of GDP'
AND g.year BETWEEN 2000 AND 2020
ORDER BY g.year
results.predicted_sql: SELECT time_periods.year, gem_observations.value AS social_benefits_percent_gdp FROM gem_observations g JOIN time_periods ON 1=1 t ON time_periods.year = time_periods.year WHERE gem_observations.country_id = 276 AND gem_observations.indicator_id = 14 ORDER BY time_periods.year

results.question: Count the number of countries with GEM data for each year
results.ground_truth_sql:
SELECT year, COUNT(DISTINCT country_id) AS country_count
FROM gem_observations
GROUP BY year
ORDER BY year
results.predicted_sql: SELECT time_periods.year, COUNT(DISTINCT countries.country_name) AS num_countries FROM gem_observations g JOIN countries ON 1=1 c ON gem_observations.country_id = gem_observations.country_id JOIN time_periods ON 1=1 t ON time_periods.year = time_periods.year GROUP BY time_periods.year ORDER BY time_periods.year;

FROM gfs_observations

results.question: List all countries with tax revenue data for 2020
results.ground_truth_sql:
SELECT DISTINCT c.country_name
FROM gfs_observations g
JOIN countries c ON g.country_id = c.country_id
JOIN indicators i ON g.indicator_id = i.indicator_id
WHERE i.indicator_name = 'Taxes, Transactions (cash basis of recording), Cash basis'
AND g.year = 2020
ORDER BY c.country_name
results.predicted_sql: SELECT countries.country_name, tr.tax_revenue FROM countries c JOIN tax_revenue ON 1=1 tr ON countries.country_id = countries.country_id WHERE tr.year = 2020;

results.question: What is the average value by sector for GFS observations in 2020?
results.ground_truth_sql:
SELECT s.sector_name, AVG(g.value) AS avg_value
FROM gfs_observations g
JOIN sectors s ON g.sector_id = s.sector_id
WHERE g.year = 2020
GROUP BY s.sector_name
ORDER BY avg_value DESC
results.predicted_sql: SELECT sectorsectors.sector_name, AVG(gfs_observations.value) AS avg_value FROM gfs_observations g JOIN sectors ON 1=1 s ON gfs_observationgfs_observations.sector_id = gfs_observations.sector_id WHERE gfs_observations.year = 2020 GROUP BY sectorsectors.sector_name ORDER BY avg_value DESC

results.question: Find the top 5 countries by combined GFS and GEM data availability (total observations)
results.ground_truth_sql:
WITH combined AS (
    SELECT country_id, 'GFS' AS source FROM gfs_observations
    UNION ALL
    SELECT country_id, 'GEM' AS source FROM gem_observations
)
SELECT c.country_name, 
       SUM(CASE WHEN source = 'GFS' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS gfs_obs,
       SUM(CASE WHEN source = 'GEM' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS gem_obs,
       COUNT(*) AS total_obs
FROM combined
JOIN countries c ON combined.country_id = c.country_id
GROUP BY c.country_name
ORDER BY total_obs DESC
LIMIT 5
results.predicted_sql: SELECT countries.country_name, gfs_observations.country_id, (gfs.obs_count + gem.obs_count) AS total_observations FROM countries c LEFT JOIN ( SELECT country_id, COUNT(*) AS obs_count FROM gfs_observations GROUP BY country_id ) gfs ON gfs_observations.country_id = gfs_observations.country_id LEFT JOIN ( SELECT country_id, COUNT(*) AS obs_count FROM gem_observations GROUP BY country_id ) gem ON gfs_observations.country_id = gfs_observations.country_id ORDER BY total_observations DESC LIMIT 5;

results.question: Calculate the correlation between government revenue and expenditure across all countries for 2019
results.ground_truth_sql:
WITH paired_data AS (
    SELECT c.country_name,
           SUM(CASE WHEN i.indicator_name LIKE '%Revenue%' THEN g.value ELSE 0 END) AS revenue,
           SUM(CASE WHEN i.indicator_name LIKE '%Expenditure%' THEN g.value ELSE 0 END) AS expenditure
    FROM gfs_observations g
    JOIN countries c ON g.country_id = c.country_id
    JOIN sectors s ON g.sector_id = s.sector_id
    JOIN indicators i ON g.indicator_id = i.indicator_id
    WHERE s.sector_name = 'General government'
    AND g.transformation = 'Percent of GDP'
    AND g.year = 2019
    GROUP BY c.country_name
    HAVING SUM(CASE WHEN i.indicator_name LIKE '%Revenue%' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) > 0
       AND SUM(CASE WHEN i.indicator_name LIKE '%Expenditure%' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) > 0
),
stats AS (
    SELECT 
        COUNT(*) AS n,
        SUM(revenue) AS sum_x,
        SUM(expenditure) AS sum_y,
        SUM(revenue * expenditure) AS sum_xy,
        SUM(revenue * revenue) AS sum_xx,
        SUM(expenditure * expenditure) AS sum_yy
    FROM paired_data
)
SELECT 
    n AS sample_size,
    (n * sum_xy - sum_x * sum_y) / 
    SQRT((n * sum_xx - sum_x * sum_x) * (n * sum_yy - sum_y * sum_y)) AS correlation
FROM stats
results.predicted_sql: SELECT g.[YEAR], g.[VALUE] AS revenue, e.[VALUE] AS expenditure FROM gfs_observations g JOIN gfs_observations ON 1=1 e ON g.[YEAR] = e.[YEAR] WHERE gfs_observations.sector_id = [ID] AND gfs_observations.sector_id = [ID] ORDER BY g.[YEAR]

results.question: Compare tax revenues as a percentage of GDP across countries with good data coverage (Singapore, Australia, Israel, South Africa, Chile) for 2020, ranking them from highest to lowest
results.ground_truth_sql:
WITH Tax_Revenue AS (
    SELECT 
        c.country_name,
        g.value AS tax_revenue_pct_gdp
    FROM gfs_observations g
    JOIN countries c ON g.country_id = c.country_id
    JOIN sectors s ON g.sector_id = s.sector_id
    JOIN indicators i ON g.indicator_id = i.indicator_id
    WHERE c.country_name IN ('Singapore', 'Australia', 'Israel', 'South Africa', 'Chile')
        AND g.year = 2020
        AND s.sector_name = 'General government'
        AND i.indicator_name = 'Taxes, Transactions (cash basis of recording), Cash basis'
        AND g.transformation = 'Percent of GDP'
),
Avg_Tax AS (
    SELECT AVG(tax_revenue_pct_gdp) AS avg_tax_revenue
    FROM Tax_Revenue
)
SELECT 
    t.country_name,
    t.tax_revenue_pct_gdp,
    a.avg_tax_revenue AS group_average,
    (t.tax_revenue_pct_gdp - a.avg_tax_revenue) AS difference_from_avg
FROM Tax_Revenue t
CROSS JOIN Avg_Tax a
ORDER BY t.tax_revenue_pct_gdp DESC
results.predicted_sql: SELECT countries.country_name, g.[YEAR] AS year, g.[VALUE] AS tax_revenue, g.[SCALE] AS scale FROM gfs_observations g JOIN countries ON 1=1 c ON g.[ID] = c.[ID] WHERE countries.country_name IN ('Singapore', 'Australia', 'Israel', 'South Africa', 'Chile') AND g.[YEAR] = [YEAR] AND g.[SCALE] = [STRING] ORDER BY g.[VALUE] DESC LIMIT [INTEGER]

results.question: Compare government expenditure between central and local government for Brazil over 2015-2022
results.ground_truth_sql:
SELECT g.year,
       SUM(CASE WHEN s.sector_name = 'Central government including social security' THEN g.value ELSE 0 END) AS central_govt,
       SUM(CASE WHEN s.sector_name = 'Local Government' THEN g.value ELSE 0 END) AS local_govt,
       SUM(CASE WHEN s.sector_name = 'Central government including social security' THEN g.value ELSE 0 END) -
       SUM(CASE WHEN s.sector_name = 'Local Government' THEN g.value ELSE 0 END) AS difference
FROM gfs_observations g
JOIN countries c ON g.country_id = c.country_id
JOIN sectors s ON g.sector_id = s.sector_id
JOIN indicators i ON g.indicator_id = i.indicator_id
WHERE c.country_name = 'Brazil'
AND i.indicator_name = 'Expenditure, Transactions (cash basis of recording), Cash basis'
AND g.transformation = 'Percent of GDP'
AND g.year BETWEEN 2015 AND 2022
GROUP BY g.year
ORDER BY g.year
results.predicted_sql: SELECT [YEAR], [METRIC] AS central_government_expenditure, [METRIC] AS local_government_expenditure FROM gfs_observations JOIN countries ON gfs_observations.[ID] = countries.[ID] JOIN sectors ON gfs_observations.sector_id = sectors.sector_id WHERE countries.country_name = [STRING] AND sectors.sector_name = [STRING] AND gfs_observations.[YEAR] BETWEEN [NUMBER] AND [NUMBER] ORDER BY gfs_observations.[YEAR]
